questions.question_text:
An architect is working with stakeholders to define requirements for architecting a new VMware vSphere design.
What are two strategies for engaging with stakeholders to achieve this goal? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The architect conducts workshops and interviews limited to those stakeholders identified in the assessment phase of the project.
choices.E: The architect conducts interviews focusing on business requirements to build the architectural business case.
choices.C: The architect conducts workshops with stakeholders to gather business and technical requirements.
choices.A: The architect conducts workshops with the virtualization technical team to gather deployment justifications.
choices.D: The architect conducts multiple rounds of interviews with stakeholders, iteratively refining requirements.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Could be A and D

choices.F: The solution will deploy a vSphere Distributed Power Management (DPM) enabled cluster with sufficient capacity to meet the workload demands.
choices.E: The solution will deploy a Distributed Resource Scheduler (DRS) enabled cluster with sufficient capacity to meet the workload demands.
choices.B: The solution will enable the Memory Metric for Load Balancing option to avoid host over-commitment.
choices.C: The solution will deploy VMware Aria Operations to monitor the vSphere environment.
choices.D: The solution will enable the VM Distribution option to avoid host over-commitment.
choices.A: The solution will enable the Predictive DRS option to avoid host over-commitment.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACE
If you are using Predictive DRS you need Aria Ops to predict the trends and there doesn't seem to be anything requiring DPM.

questions.question_text:
An architect is updating an existing design to include a new vSphere cluster to meet the following customer requirements:
The solution must provide automatic load redistribution of workloads across all resources in the cluster
The solution must consider the usage patterns of workloads when performing load redistribution
The solution must provide capacity to reserve resources equal to two ESXi hosts for failover in the event of a host failure
The architect has also collected the following assumptions and constraints during the design workshops:
A001 - Budget is available for additional hardware and software if required to meet the solution requirements
A002 - Capacity is available to allow the deployment of additional tooling to manage the solution
C001 - All management workloads must be deployed to the existing vSphere management cluster
Which three design decisions should the architect include to meet the documented requirements? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Deploying the traffic on a VSAN VMK sounds like the best answer.

questions.question_text:
An architect is designing a new workload domain in an existing VMware Cloud Foundation environment. The customer requirement is to physically separate the vSAN network traffic from other management network flows.
Which design decision should the architect make to meet this requirement?

choices.C: Deploy the new workload domain using SDDC Manager.
choices.A: Deploy the new workload domain using a vSAN stretched cluster.
choices.D: Deploy the new workload domain using API.
choices.B: Deploy the new workload domain using multiple physical adapters.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Offloading the CPU's to the DPU does sound right.

choices.C: Use vSphere Distributed Services Engine with Data Processing Units (DPUs) in the ESXi host hardware
choices.A: Use vSphere Distributed Resource Scheduler (DRS) with affinity rules to keep the virtual machines on the same ESXi hosts
choices.D: Use vSphere Distributed Resource Scheduler (DRS) with SmartNICs in the ESXi host hardware
choices.B: Use vSphere Distributed Services Engine with Network I/O Control on the distributed switch

questions.question_text:
An architect is designing a new vSphere solution. The customer has stated that the solution will be used to host different types of applications, some of which have special considerations. The customer has provided the following information in relation to the special considerations:
The applications are sensitive to the time it takes for CPUs to be accessible to process instructions
The applications send and receive large amounts of data across the network
The applications are sensitive to the time it takes for the data to be sent and received at the destination
What could the architect include in the design for these considerations?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A.

Selected Answer: A
My selection is A - Rebranding in Mexico

questions.question_text:
An architect is tasked with designing a repeatable edge hosting solution using VMware technologies that can be deployed to existing hotels across the world and operate independently of other locations.
During interviews with stakeholders, the architect notes the following information:
There are 123 hotels in total.
All hotels have a minimum of two 1 Gbps connections for guest Internet access.
The company operates hotels in four countries: Canada, USA, Cuba and Mexico.
The company is rebranding the hotels located in Mexico.
Which of these is a business factor that will impact this design?

choices.A: The company is rebranding the hotels located in Mexico.
choices.B: The company operates hotels in four countries: Canada, USA, Cuba and Mexico.
choices.D: All hotels have a minimum of two 1 Gbps connections for guest Internet access.
